ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write a well-organized research paper as well as to give a short TED talk to an audience.
I have learned to deconstruct others' arguments and build my strong ones of my own.
How to thoroughly research and present on a variety of topics relating to a multitude of fields. Furthermore, I gained lots of expertise on analyzing scholarly journals and becoming a better reader.
Effective communication (public speaking as well as writing) is the most important skill I developed. Several meta skills such as quick thinking, participating in a seminar, and peer review.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course really forces you to think about writing in a way that many freshmen have not before. The process is hard, but you come out of it with a much more critical eye. Professor Klemann really works hard to make sure that all her students get the help that they need!
I liked the small classroom setting the course gave. However, we could do some more excursions to the libraries present at Yale because I found those to be very useful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely recommend this course. Very fun and engaging!
I would recommend this course as the first WR credit to a student because it really will improve your writing and prep you for other writing classes in the future.
Yes this course is great to increase your writing skills and become better at analyzing texts.
